Read MIPTools tables

Source: R/read-tbl.R
read-tbl.Rd

The read_tbl_*() family of functions is designed to read data tables generated by the software program MIPTools. Data is read lazily using the vroom package. Data can be filtered, retaining all rows that satisfy the conditions. To be retained, the row in question must produce a value of TRUE for all conditions. Note that when a condition evaluates to NA, the row will be dropped.

Usage

read_tbl_reference(.tbl, ...)

read_tbl_alternate(.tbl, ...)

read_tbl_coverage(.tbl, ...)

read_tbl_genotype(.tbl, ...)

read_tbl_haplotype(.tbl, ..., .col_select = NULL)

read_tbl_ref_alt_cov(
  .tbl_ref,
  .tbl_alt,
  .tbl_cov,
  ...,
  chrom = deprecated(),
  gene = deprecated()
)

Arguments

.tbl

File path to the table.

...

<data-masking> Filtering expressions. Expressions must return a logical value. If multiple expressions are included, they are combined with the & operator. Only rows for which all conditions evaluate to TRUE are kept.

.col_select

Columns to include in the results. Columns can be selected using one or more selection expressions as in dplyr::select(). Use c() or list() to use more than one expression. See ?tidyselect::language for details on available selection options.

.tbl_ref

File path to the reference table.

.tbl_alt

File path to the alternate table.

.tbl_cov

File path to the coverage table.

chrom

The chromosome(s) to filter to.

gene

The gene(s) to filter to.

Value

A tibble(). The first six columns contain the metadata associated with each sample and mutation. The last column contains the information parsed from the table. In some cases, this may be the umi_count and in other cases it may be the coverage of the associated data point.

Data structure

Input data must contain six rows of metadata. The metadata can vary depending on what type of file is read, but typically contains information about the location of a mutation. The remaining rows represent the data for each sample sequenced.

Useful filter functions

The dplyr::filter() function is employed to subset the rows of the data applying the expressions in ... to the column values to determine which rows should be retained.

There are many functions and operators that are useful when constructing the expressions used to filter the data:

  • ==, >, >=, etc.

  • &, |, !, xor()

  • is.na()

  • between(), near()

See also

vroom::vroom() dplyr::filter()

Examples

# Get path to example file
ref_file <- miplicorn_example("reference_AA_table.csv")
alt_file <- miplicorn_example("alternate_AA_table.csv")
cov_file <- miplicorn_example("coverage_AA_table.csv")
ref_file
#> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/miplicorn/extdata/reference_AA_table.csv"

# Input sources -------------------------------------------------------------
# Read from a path
read_tbl_reference(ref_file)
#> # A reference table: 6,344 × 8
#>    sample     gene_id       gene  mutation_name  exoni…¹ aa_ch…² targe…³ ref_u…⁴
#>    <chr>      <chr>         <chr> <chr>          <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl>
#>  1 D10-JJJ-23 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         608
#>  2 D10-JJJ-43 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes          20
#>  3 D10-JJJ-55 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         158
#>  4 D10-JJJ-5  PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           2
#>  5 D10-JJJ-47 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           1
#>  6 D10-JJJ-15 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         129
#>  7 D10-JJJ-27 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#>  8 D10-JJJ-10 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#>  9 D10-JJJ-28 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes          90
#> 10 D10-JJJ-52 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         175
#> # … with 6,334 more rows, and abbreviated variable names ¹​exonic_func,
#> #   ²​aa_change, ³​targeted, ⁴​ref_umi_count
#> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows

# You can also use paths directly
# read_tbl_alternate("alternate_AA_table.csv")

# Read entire file ----------------------------------------------------------
read_tbl_coverage(cov_file)
#> # A coverage table: 6,344 × 8
#>    sample     gene_id       gene  mutation_name  exoni…¹ aa_ch…² targe…³ cover…⁴
#>    <chr>      <chr>         <chr> <chr>          <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl>
#>  1 D10-JJJ-23 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         608
#>  2 D10-JJJ-43 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes          20
#>  3 D10-JJJ-55 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         158
#>  4 D10-JJJ-5  PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           2
#>  5 D10-JJJ-47 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           1
#>  6 D10-JJJ-15 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         129
#>  7 D10-JJJ-27 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#>  8 D10-JJJ-10 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#>  9 D10-JJJ-28 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes          90
#> 10 D10-JJJ-52 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         175
#> # … with 6,334 more rows, and abbreviated variable names ¹​exonic_func,
#> #   ²​aa_change, ³​targeted, ⁴​coverage
#> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows

# Data filtering ------------------------------------------------------------
# Filtering by one criterion
read_tbl_reference(ref_file, gene == "atp6")
#> # A reference table: 260 × 8
#>    sample     gene_id       gene  mutation_name  exoni…¹ aa_ch…² targe…³ ref_u…⁴
#>    <chr>      <chr>         <chr> <chr>          <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl>
#>  1 D10-JJJ-23 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         608
#>  2 D10-JJJ-43 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes          20
#>  3 D10-JJJ-55 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         158
#>  4 D10-JJJ-5  PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           2
#>  5 D10-JJJ-47 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           1
#>  6 D10-JJJ-15 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         129
#>  7 D10-JJJ-27 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#>  8 D10-JJJ-10 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#>  9 D10-JJJ-28 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes          90
#> 10 D10-JJJ-52 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes         175
#> # … with 250 more rows, and abbreviated variable names ¹​exonic_func,
#> #   ²​aa_change, ³​targeted, ⁴​ref_umi_count
#> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows

# Filtering by multiple criteria within a single logical expression
read_tbl_alternate(alt_file, gene == "atp6" & targeted == "Yes")
#> # An alternate table: 156 × 8
#>    sample     gene_id       gene  mutation_name  exoni…¹ aa_ch…² targe…³ alt_u…⁴
#>    <chr>      <chr>         <chr> <chr>          <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl>
#>  1 D10-JJJ-23 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#>  2 D10-JJJ-43 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#>  3 D10-JJJ-55 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#>  4 D10-JJJ-5  PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#>  5 D10-JJJ-47 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0

#> 10 D10-JJJ-52 PF3D7_0106300 atp6  atp6-Ala623Glu missen… Ala623… Yes           0
#> # … with 146 more rows, and abbreviated variable names ¹​exonic_func,
#> #   ²​aa_change, ³​targeted, ⁴​alt_umi_count
#> # ℹ Use `print(n = ...)` to see more rows
read_tbl_coverage(cov_file, gene == "atp6" | targeted == "Yes")
#> # A coverage table: 2,496 × 8
#>    sample     gene_id       gene  mutation_name  exoni…¹ aa_ch…² targe…³ cover…⁴
#>    <chr>      <chr>         <chr> <chr>          <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <dbl>

# When multiple expressions are used, they are combined using &
read_tbl_reference(ref_file, gene == "atp6", targeted == "Yes")
#> # A reference table: 156 × 8
#>    sample     gene_id       gene  mutation_name  exoni…¹ aa_ch…² targe…³ ref_u…⁴

# Read multiple files together ----------------------------------------------
read_tbl_ref_alt_cov(ref_file, alt_file, cov_file)
#> # A ref alt cov table: 6,344 × 10
#>    sample  gene_id gene  mutat…¹ exoni…² aa_ch…³ targe…⁴ ref_u…⁵ alt_u…⁶ cover…⁷
